problem_text:
Let F be a free group. An element ω ∈ F is said to be primitive if there is a minimal generating system of F that contains ω, almost primitive if it is primitive in each finitely generated proper subgroup of F containing ω, tame almost primitive if, whenever ω^α is contained in a subgroup H of F with α ⩾ 1 minimal, either ω^α is primitive in H or the index of H in F is just α.
In (B. Fine, A. Moldenhauer, G. Rosenberger, L. Wienke, Topics in Infinite Group Theory: Nielsen Methods, Covering Spaces, and Hyperbolic Groups, De Gruyter, Berlin, 2021) it is shown that u = [a1, b1][a2, b2] · · · [ag, bg] is tame almost primitive in the free group on a1, b1, . . . , ag, bg with g ⩾ 1, and v = c1^2 · · · cp^2 is tame almost primitive in the free group on c1, . . . , cp with p ⩾ 2.
Are there tame almost primitive elements in free groups other than u, v, and their product uv in the free group on a1, b1, . . . , ag, bg, c1, . . . , cp?
G. Rosenberger, L. Wienke
